letters.description: Utilize sensory acuity to observe non-verbal cues and establish deep rapport to understand the client's current internal state.
Define well-formed outcomes that are sensory-specific, compelling, and ecologically sound for the client's life.
Employ Meta-Model and Milton-Model patterns to uncover deep structures and challenge limiting linguistic maps.
Apply submodality shifts, anchoring, or reframing techniques to alter internal representations and break habitual patterns.
Execute future pacing to bridge the transformation to real-world scenarios and ensure the new program is fully integrated.
